intro: Isonandra krantziana, commonly known as the Krantz's isonandra, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
